intro: Mesadenella esmeraldae, commonly known as the Emerald Tunicate, is a colonial ascidian belonging to the family Polycladidae. It is characterized by its translucent, gelatinous bodies that form dense, bush-like colonies. The organism exhibits a unique symbiotic relationship with algae, which it hosts within its internal cavities. Its habitat is typically found in shallow tropical marine environments, where it thrives on rocky substrates. Due to its delicate structure and limited geographic distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
